title: Approximations for the Weighted Reversal, Transposition, and Indel Distance Problem with Intergenic Region Information
summary: Genome rearrangement distances are an established method in genome comparison. Works in this area may include various rearrangement operations representing large-scale mutations, gene orientation information, the number of nucleotides in intergenic regions, and weights reflecting the expected frequency of each operation.
